Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: So longest are cases with high complexity and multiple requests for additional documents causing delays, especially case2005 and maybe case2003 but less than case2005 but still long due to repeated requests and region A vs B?

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Lets analyze attributes: Resources: CSR_Jane handled low complexity quickly; CSR_Paul high complexity took long due to multiple docs; CSR_Mary low complexity quick; Manager_Ann quick for low complexity but moderate for medium etc. Region A vs B differences? Case2003 region A high complexity had repeated request events on same day and next day, leading to longer time but still less than B region high complexity case which had many requests across multiple days maybe due to resource availability or backlog in region Bs adjuster Lisa who had many tasks causing delays between requests and approvals. Complexity obviously major factor because high leads more steps like additional documents etc., increasing duration significantly compared with low or medium cases that finish within a few hours/days.

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Root causes: - High-complexity claims require more documentation leading to multiple Request Additional Documents events, each incurring waiting time for claimant response or internal review. - Resource bottlenecks e.g., Adjuster_Lisa in Region B appears overloaded causing delays between evaluation and approval/request events. - Manager_Bill handling high-complexity claims may have longer approval times due diligence. - Finance_Carl vs Finance_Alan differences minimal though finance may be slower if overloaded with many payments in Region B?

Name: Hypothesis Generation - PE
Text: Mitigation suggestions: - Automate document collection via digital portal reducing manual request cycles. - Assign dedicated adjusters for high-complexity claims or increase staffing in Region B where adjuster Lisa is bottlenecked. - Use parallel processing where possible e.g., while awaiting documents, other tasks can proceed such as payment preparation if partial data available. - Implement SLA thresholds per activity by complexity level; trigger alerts when waiting times exceed thresholds. - Provide training/resources for CSR_Paul & others on efficient claim intake procedures especially for complex cases. Also consider resource rotation or cross-training across regions reduce regional bottlenecks.
